title: Vote for your favourite Ocean Week artwork!

replies.body: also two of the submissions cheated: http://san-ru.deviantart.com/art/Pool-Party-Vi-424853917 http://jeiko-chan.deviantart.com/art/League-of-Legends-beach-time-387545048
Good catch! I knew I recognised the first one, but didn't check whether it had been posted before this contest was announced.
Thank you so much for pointing that out! I will definitely get that sorted shortly!
This was pointed out on **Twitter **as well, would've thought it'd be seen and caught before being put on the shortlist. x_x
Can you include more entries to chose from? I don't think there is enough..
So true, i posted mine on Instagram and i don't see mine up there... Riot please at least give others a chance who've posted on Instagram and Twitter! {{champion:6}}
Yeah I definitely agree, there were plenty of amazing drawings that people had posted on both twitter and instagram, they should at least be recognized as part of the entry list!
Maybe there were not about ocean week?
They were, plenty of ones beached themed
I know right, there were so many great ones on instagram
Riot please speak to us

Imo, I wish they'd put everyone's artworks on the list I mean a lot of people out there put so much time and effort within their artworks for the fun of the competition. Give everyone a chance for their artworks to be shown to at least give them the feeling that they've accomplished something and is something to be proud of :P sorry if my english doesn't make any sense >_<
Only 17 options for 10 winners? Seems really unfair to me. Please include more variety, there are so many talented artists in this community who deserve a chance!!

They should at least gather all the entries and post them up so people can see the great work everyone has put into this competition (like most of the previous fan art contests in NA). We don't even get to see the majority of submissions

Here is what I think the Ocean Week Comp should be run. Say that you're told to select 20 images for the short-list. I would select 5 images from hand drawn, painting, digital, and the remaining five can be from the either of the 3 categories. 

In my opinion, I think that selecting most of the images being digital is not fair for the people who hand drawn or did a painting and submitting it to either Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.
Agreed, but I also think it should be held in legs as well. 20 one day, 20 the next etc. Then the top 20 out of those goes in a final vote for top 10
what happened to all of the instagram artworks? i dont see any of em here?
i dont understand how cheaters made it past the shortlist, and people who entered properly, did not

Hey RedGlaceon,

That was a mistake on our end. The stolen artwork has been taken down and replaced with new pieces.

All those who are complaining should stop, Riot is doing their best and for those who are complaining about their artworks not making the shortlist, that's because IT'S A SHORTLIST, Riot took their favorite artworks and put them up for voting, so if yours isn't there then just don't worry, you know you did a good job so why bother complaining to Riot, they too know how much effort you all put in, but sadly they can't please everyone and you can't have everything, that's just the way it is, look on the bright side, at least Ocean Week has been fun and successful. It might not seem this way to you, but even if your artwork wasn't shortlisted you still contributed to the event and should be proud of your work and your contribution.

really? you really think that?
i barely see half of the great artworks ive seen on twitter and instagram, its not that riot picked it out, its that people wasnt able to sent it to the fanart catagory on facebook and posted on twitter and instagram due to that but no. riot decided to not post the one that we sent on instagram and twitter. i mean really, theres about most of us who spent long nights trying our hardest finishing a piece of artwork for riot. its pretty affective towards us artists

"they too know how much effort you all put in"

No, they don't. If I lose because the competition is superior that's one thing, but if they tell us we can enter by Twitter, Instagram or Facebook they need to actually look at the entries by all three methods.

Hi. I feel as if this competition was not fair at all.. Hand drawn pieces are much less vibrant in colours and are less enhanceable compared to computer programs.. If you take a second to look at the short list you'll notice that there is only one physical artwork out of the 20 originally (now 18). And if you think about it.. If you got the people who submitted artworks that were created using computer programs to hand draw their pieces then they wouldnt even come close to looking as good as they do on a screen. This competition wasted many hours for the people that did physical art works... So unfair.. Should have been split from physical to pixelated pieces.. Hate how this competition was set up.. Waste of 13 hours.
is it just because mine s  hand drawn, this s so unfair ,all the ones that got in r 2 digital , i spent hours and hours drawing by hand and at the end not even an entry.
lol, i pulled 2 allnighters, but oh well, personally i reckon hand drawn and digital would be more even. but it is riot's decision, and i respect it.
Did you check the fanart posted under "Diorama" because you screwed up the Facebook submission form?
Yup we looked at that too
Thank you.
thank you so much! :)
Yeh I agree. A lot of us poster our artworks under "Diorama" category.

https://twitter.com/tienniee/status/559953132734521344/photo/1

c:
damn nice

I couldn't post mine on the Facebook page because it only had the diorama option. I didn't really know how to post it properly on Twitter, I just want to confirm that if I tagged with #OceanWeekComp and did the @LOL_Oceania tag it would have been entered? Here's a link in case it didn't https://twitter.com/CarlyElycium/status/559534282855559168
Thats really amazing!

Hey everyone, 

I just wanted to clarify a few points.

We did receive all the Twitter and Instagram submissions (#Oceanweekcomp) (The short list includes artworks from all platforms)

A panel of rioters decided the short list from all of the submissions

We did have a filter for copied art submissions but it seems to have missed a couple. So once again thank you to the awesome community members that have helped us by pointing that out. We have taken them down and replaced them with new pieces!

"We did receive all the Twitter and Instagram submissions (#Oceanweekcomp) (The short list includes artworks from all platforms)"

But does it include Facebook? Your Facebook app did not allow people to submit fan art into the "Fan Art" category - only as Dioramas. Were these included in your judging?
We did get the Facebook submissions including the ones under Diorama

Thanks for posting this.
Although it would of been great if you guys had of put that information up to begin with. Eliminates confusion and frustration before it happens.
Is there any reason why you have given us so few to pick from? I mean, it's a contest that has 10 winners and there are under 20 to pick from...
If I've posted my work on my own deviantart prior to entering it in the comp, would it have been filtered out?
It would have been considered as long as it was made specifically for this contest

Dear riot

Can you please clear a small understanding of mine? I submitted an art work consisting of Nami and poro swimming in the **Ocean** (http://t.co/CZ2jeVrasQ) for the competition because that's how I interpreted Ocean week. However most of the drawings in the short list are champions having fun on the beach. So I would just like to know, if that's one of the reason that I couldn't even make it in the short list then maybe it should be Beach week instead, to avoid confusions? Like majority of others I spent hours on the drawing, hoping that I can get recognized and approved by the community but I wasn't even given the chance ..

Or am I the only one that didn't get the memo saying ocean = beach :c
cries bc some ppl put alotta effort into their entry and the majority of them arent up there .. aha sighs

Hi, I entered my drawing onto Facebook at exactly 3:02PM on the 26th (it still said I could enter) but I could only select the 'Diorama' category. I am aware my artwork is not shown on the voting poll (facebook is down for my internet, I was told by a friend). Could I re-enter if possible? The artwork is titled Leona and co. (or Pool party Leona and friends).
i put mine in the diorama section too and mines up there

more fan art from my girlfriend 
http://instagram.com/p/yWTg4-myd9/?modal=true
